definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: I wolfed the whole two pounds of bread without stopping to take breath.
sentences.chinese: 我狼吞虎嚥地一口氣把整整兩磅麪包幹掉了。

sentences.english: The prototypes they have now let you fly a whole 30 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 現在研究出來的原型機只能讓你飛整整的30秒。

sentences.english: The whole trip took him 19 years before he returned to Chang'an.
sentences.chinese: 花了整整十九年的時間，最後回到了長安。

sentences.english: Later, Gongxing Lun at the beginning of a long self-study and examination, a full 7 years.
sentences.chinese: 後來，龔興倫開頭了漫長的自學和考試，整整7年。

sentences.english: Cicadas chirp, spin it for a whole century.
sentences.chinese: 蟬鳴聲，推少了整整一個世紀。

sentences.english: For one whole year Bill ignores the dog.
sentences.chinese: 整整一年，比爾忽視這個大丹犬。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked our foremost positions all night.
sentences.chinese: 整整一夜敵人攻打了我們的前沿陣地。

sentences.english: We both had been sitting on the Longquan hill for whole day.
sentences.chinese: 我們倆坐在龍泉山上，整整一天沒有下來。

sentences.english: She wsa make the plane the whole night.
sentences.chinese: 她偉成船務使飛機了整整一夜。

sentences.english: Alison was the first one to start, and has been skating for the whole five hours.
sentences.chinese: 艾麗森是第一個開始滑的，已經滑了整整五個小時。

sentences.english: Ten months on he trimmed four full seconds from his time.
sentences.chinese: 時隔十個月，他的成績整整縮短了四秒。

sentences.english: She ranted and raved for two whole days and wouldn't listen to reason.
sentences.chinese: 她大叫大嚷吵了整整兩天，什麼也聽不進去。

sentences.english: But now I can give her ten or even a whole sackful.
sentences.chinese: 但是現在我能借給她十個，甚至整整一袋了。

sentences.english: Early that day, during what was a weeklong trip to China, she visited Mr.
sentences.chinese: 馮姐在中國的行程有整整一週。

sentences.english: After death, the human body decomposes through four stages.
sentences.chinese: 人死之後，屍體的分解需要經過整整四個階段。

sentences.english: The Germans took over a century to build this water bridge.
sentences.chinese: 德國人花了整整一個多世紀才建成這座馬格德堡水橋。

definition: to extend as long as/to lengthen out to
to calculate/to estimate/in total/all told/(fig.) if you think about it
almost/nearly/more or less/about the same/good enough/not bad
separated in time (usu. followed by a quantity of time)
